content.question: ​Which of the following is the graph of an exponential function of the form <math alttext="y equals a b to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where the horizontal axis is a standard scale and the vertical axis is a logarithmic scale?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 10 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from 1 to 10 in increments of 1. 

The tick marks get closer and closer together moving from 1 to 10. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve appears to be increasing and concave down and begins at (2 comma 2).

The curve increases to pass through (3 comma 3), (4 comma 4), (5 comma 5), (6 comma 6), (7 comma 7), (8 comma 8), (9 comma 9), and (10 comma 10), at which point it ends.

The x axis ranges from 0 to 10 in increments of 1.

The y axis ranges from 1 to 100, where 1, 10 and 100 are equally spaced. 

Tick marks for 1 through 10 are shown, but the tick marks get closer and closer together moving from 1 to 10. 

Tick marks for 10 through 100 are shown, but the tick marks get closer and closer together moving from 10 to 100. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve appears to be increasing and concave down and begins at (2 comma 4).

The curve increases, passing through (3 comma 9), (4 comma 16), (5 comma 25), (6 comma 36), (7 comma 49), (8 comma 64), (9 comma 81), and (10 comma 100), at which point it ends.

The x axis ranges from 0 to 10 in increments of 1.

The y axis ranges from 1 to 1000, where 1, 10, 100, and 1000 are equally spaced. 

Tick marks for 1 through 10 are shown, but the tick marks get closer and closer together moving from 1 to 10. 

The tick marks for 10 through 100 and the tick marks for 100 through 1000 are similarly shown. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve appears to be linear.

The curve begins at (0 comma 1).

The curve increases, passing through (1 comma 2), (2 comma 4), (3 comma 8), (4 comma 16), (5 comma 32), (6 comma 64), (7 comma 128), (8 comma 256), (9 comma 512), and ends near (10 comma 1000).

The x axis ranges from 0 to 10 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from 1 to 10,000,000,000, where powers of 10 are equally spaced. 

Nine tick marks are shown between each power of 10, but the tick marks get closer and closer together moving up. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve appears to be increasing and concave up and begins at (1 comma 3).

The curve increases, passing through (2 comma 7), (3 comma 30), (4 comma 300), (5 comma 3,000), (6 comma 60,000), (7 comma 900,000), (8 comma 18,000,000), (9 comma 400,000,000), and (10 comma 10,000,000,000), at which point it ends.

content.answer:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 10 in increments of 1.

The y axis ranges from 1 to 1000, where 1, 10, 100, and 1000 are equally spaced. 

Tick marks for 1 through 10 are shown, but the tick marks get closer and closer together moving from 1 to 10. 

The tick marks for 10 through 100 and the tick marks for 100 through 1000 are similarly shown. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve appears to be linear.

The curve begins at (0 comma 1).

The curve increases, passing through (1 comma 2), (2 comma 4), (3 comma 8), (4 comma 16), (5 comma 32), (6 comma 64), (7 comma 128), (8 comma 256), (9 comma 512), and ends near (10 comma 1000).
